1.text: Now this is the history of the generations of the sons of Noah and of Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Sons were born to them after the flood.

2.text: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

3.text: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.

4.text: The sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.

5.text: Of these were the islands of the nations divided in their lands, everyone after his language, after their families, in their nations.

6.text: The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

7.text: The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.

8.text: Cush became the father of Nimrod. He began to be a mighty one in the earth.

9.text: He was a mighty hunter before Yahweh. Therefore it is said, “Like Nimrod, a mighty hunter before Yahweh.”

10.text: The beginning of his kingdom was Babel, Erech, Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.

11.text: Out of that land he went into Assyria, and built Nineveh, Rehoboth Ir, Calah,

12.text: and Resen between Nineveh and Calah (the same is the great city).

13.text: Mizraim became the father of Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,

14.text: Pathrusim, Casluhim (which the Philistines descended from), and Caphtorim.

15.text: Canaan became the father of Sidon (his firstborn), Heth,

16.text: the Jebusite, the Amorite, the Girgashite,

17.text: the Hivite, the Arkite, the Sinite,

18.text: the Arvadite, the Zemarite, and the Hamathite. Afterward the families of the Canaanites were spread abroad.

19.text: The border of the Canaanites was from Sidon, as you go toward Gerar, to Gaza; as you go toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, to Lasha.

20.text: These are the sons of Ham, after their families, after their languages, in their lands, in their nations.

21.text: To Shem, the father of all the children of Eber, the elder brother of Japheth, to him also were children born.

22.text: The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, and Aram.

23.text: The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.

24.text: Arpachshad became the father of Shelah. Shelah became the father of Eber.

25.text: To Eber were born two sons. The name of the one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided. His brother’s name was Joktan.

26.text: Joktan became the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

29.text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.

30.text: Their dwelling was from Mesha, as you go toward Sephar, the mountain of the east.

31.text: These are the sons of Shem, after their families, after their languages, in their lands, after their nations.

32.text: These are the families of the sons of Noah, after their generations, in their nations. Of these were the nations divided in the earth after the flood.
